content.text: The Magic Door creaks open, and you stumble into a glittering dungeon chamber.
Piles of coins glimmer, potions bubble in glass bottles, and‚Ä¶ socks? Lots of socks. Who even brings socks into a dungeon?! üß¶
The guild master claps your shoulder:

"Hero, no one survives on a single sword and a smelly goblin tooth. You must learn the magic of the Loot Bag. With it, you can collect, sort, and manage treasures. For the road ahead, even the weirdest junk may save your life‚Ä¶ or at least fetch a good price at the marketplace.‚Äù
This week, you‚Äôll master lists:
Packing loot into your bag. Picking items out. Adding shiny things, tossing broken junk. Showing off your entire haul to jealous villagers.
Tags Introduced:
A list is like your hero‚Äôs magical inventory bag.
It doesn‚Äôt hold just one thing ‚Äî it can hold many treasures together.
Example:
Square brackets [] are like the straps of your bag. Each item inside is tucked safely away.
Hero Training Drill 1 ‚Äì Starter Loot Bag üéí

items: You wake up at the dungeon entrance with only your underwear. Embarrassing.
The guild kindly hands you three survival items: "dagger", "potion", "map".
Your task is to pack them into your new Loot Bag.

content.text: Steps:
Create a list called inventory. Put the 3 starter items inside. Print the inventory to prove you packed them.

content.starter_code:
# Write your Python code here
print("Hello, World!")

content.text: Villager: ‚ÄúGood job. Now you don‚Äôt look like a tourist anymore.‚Äù
Every list item has a position (index), starting from 0.

items: Think of your loot bag having numbered pockets:

content.text: Example:

content.starter_code:
inventory = ["sword", "potion", "shield"] 
print(inventory[0])   # sword 
print(inventory[-1])  # shield 
print(inventory[0:2]) # ['sword', 'potion']

content.text: It‚Äôs like saying: ‚ÄúReach into the first pocket for your sword‚Äù or ‚ÄúGrab the last pocket item for your shield.‚Äù
Hero Training Drill 2 ‚Äì Grab the Potion üíä

items: You‚Äôve been poisoned by a sneaky trap. The healer yells:
"Quick! Drink your potion before you turn green and smell worse than a goblin‚Äôs armpit!‚Äù
Print the last item (map) using negative indexing.

content.starter_code:
# Write your Python code here
print("Hello, World!")

content.text: Healer: ‚ÄúWhew! That was close. You almost became zombie furniture.‚Äù
Lists are magical ‚Äî you can change them at will.

items: append(item) ‚Üí toss an item into the bag‚Äôs bottom.
insert(position, item) ‚Üí slip an item into a specific pocket.
pop() ‚Üí pull something out (default = last item).

content.text: Example:

content.starter_code:
inventory = ["sword", "potion"] 
# add at end
inventory.append("shield")

# insert at position 1 
inventory.insert(1, "boots") 

# remove by name 
inventory.remove("potion")    

print(inventory)

content.text: Like stuffing more junk in, or finally throwing away that smelly sock.
Hero Training Drill 3 ‚Äì Add and Drop Loot üó°Ô∏è
Mission Briefing:

items: On your way through the dungeon:
But your "dagger" snaps in half during a fight. Sad trombone üé∫.

content.starter_code:
# Write your Python code here
print("Hello, World!")

content.text: Blacksmith: ‚ÄúDagger broke? Told you not to buy from GoblinMart.‚Äù
You can march through your entire loot bag item by item using a loop. It‚Äôs like dumping everything on the floor and naming them one by one.
Example:
Merchants love this ‚Äî they always want to know everything you‚Äôre carrying before they overcharge you.
Hero Training Drill 4 ‚Äì Inventory Check üßæ

items: A suspicious guild guard stops you at the city gate:
"Show me your items! No smelly cheese wheels or cursed ferret tails allowed!‚Äù

content.starter_code:
# Write your Python code here
print("Hello, World!")
content.expected_output:
You carry: helmet 
You carry: potion 
You carry: map 
You carry: gold

content.text: Guard: ‚ÄúHmm. Clean inventory. You may pass‚Ä¶ but keep your socks hidden.‚Äù

items: At the deepest part of the dungeon, you discover a massive treasure chest.
When you open it, the chest burps (don‚Äôt ask why), revealing:

content.text: ["gold", "sword", "potion", "socks", "shield"]

The Chest Spirit growls:
"You may only keep treasures if you manage them wisely. Fail, and I‚Äôll curse you with 1,000 socks.‚Äù

Tasks (Step by Step) Print the entire chest (to admire the loot). Grab only the potion (indexing). Slice out the first 3 items (coins, sword, potion). Add "helmet" to the chest. Remove "socks" (before the smell infects everything). Loop through the final chest and proudly display each item.

content.starter_code:
chest = ["gold", "sword", "potion", "socks", "shield"] 

# 1 
print(chest)               
# 2 -> potion 
print(chest[2])
# 3 ->['gold','sword','potion']            
print(chest[0:3]) 
# 4 
chest.append("helmet")
# 5       
chest.remove("socks")
# 6     
for item in chest:           
    print("Loot item:", item)
content.expected_output:
['gold', 'sword', 'potion', 'socks', 'shield'] 
potion 
['gold', 'sword', 'potion'] 
Loot item: gold 
Loot item: sword 
Loot item: potion 
Loot item: shield 
Loot item: helmet

content.text: "Fine‚Ä¶ take the shiny things. But leave my socks alone! Do you heroes know how hard it is to find matching pairs underground?!"

Heroes know how to create inventories with lists. 
They can grab specific loot with indexing and slicing.
They can add treasures, remove junk, and rearrange their bags.
They can loop through loot like a real merchant. 
Their hero now has a real loot bag system ‚Äî the adventure feels alive with items to track and manage.
üìú Pack-Building Camp ‚Äî Pip learns to store items in a hero backpack.

items: A list stores multiple items in one variable using [ ].
Lists can hold strings, numbers, or a mix.
Use print() to see the whole list.

content.text:
bag = ["potion", "rope", "torch"]
print(bag)
# Output: ['potion', 'rope', 'torch']

nums = [1, 2, 3]
print(nums)

mixed = ["gold", 10, True]
print(mixed)
Section: List Index Slice
Remedial practice for this tag.
More examples and practice will go here.
Section: List Mutate
‚úçÔ∏è Backpack Editing Station ‚Äî Pip adds, swaps, and removes items safely.

bag = ["potion", "rope"]
bag.append("torch")
print(bag)  # ['potion','rope','torch']

bag[0] = "super potion"
print(bag)  # ['super potion','rope','torch']

bag.remove("rope")
print(bag)  # ['super potion','torch']
Section: List Iterate
üì£ Roll Call Parade ‚Äî the guild reads every item in the hero‚Äôs pack.

items: Use a for-loop to visit each item in a list.
You can also loop with indices using range(len(list)).

‚úÖ Solution:
monsters=["goblin","slime"]
for m in monsters:
    print("Defeat:", m)

content.text: Section: List
Remedial practice for this tag.
More examples and practice will go here.
Section: Boss Challenge
üóùÔ∏è Boss Challenge ‚Äî Pack & Battle Planner

items: Access items by index and slice.
Loop through the final list to print a pack report.

content.text:
pack = ["sword", "potion", "rope"]

# access
print("First item:", pack[0])
print("Last item:", pack[-1])
print("Middle slice:", pack[1:3])

# mutate
pack.append("torch")
pack[1] = "mega potion"
pack.pop(2)  # remove rope

# iterate
for item in pack:
    print("Pack contains:", item)
